Description: Lip and wall fragment with part of handle root of East Greek pottery bowl, perhaps lotus or rosette bowl; the interior glazed black with added white and red bands. Outside, top of lip glazed; single ray preserved alongside handle; broad glazed band below; reserved at lowest part of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 56, no. 195 pl. 46)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1032)
